title: 'I've had long Covid for two years now'
description: Why are so many people still living with long Covid after two years and are there any hopes for treatment?

title: Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022: England could face Scotland or Wales in group stage
description: England could face Scotland or Wales at the Fifa World Cup Qatar 2022 after the draw for the tournament's finals was made on Friday.

title: Lateral flow tests: Should I recycle the plastic?
description: Scientists say more could have been done to make lateral flow tests widely recyclable.

title: Ukraine: Why the cartoon Masyanya was banned in Russia
description: Masyanya is a YouTube cartoon star in Russia, but her episode on the Ukraine war has been banned.

title: Ghislaine Maxwell bid for retrial denied
description: A US judge upholds Ghislaine Maxwell's sex trafficking conviction, denying her bid for a new trial.

title: Ukraine round-up: Possible war crimes and an attack on Russia
description: Day 37 saw Russia accuse Ukraine of bombing an oil facility on its territory, and the BBC witnessed possible evidence of war crimes.

title: Researchers in Hong Kong create 'soft robot' made of magnetic slime
description: The team hope the slime could one day be used to collect accidentally-swallowed objects.

title: Prince Andrew repays cash amid financial dispute
description: The Duke of York returns £750,000 claimed to have been "misappropriated" from its Turkish owner.

title: Battle for Irpin: Russian forces pushed out of Kyiv suburb
description: Orla Guerin returns to Irpin, where the Ukrainian military has forced a Russian retreat.

title: One mother's mission to ban 'vulgar' books
description: Challenges to books about sexual and racial identity have been common in US schools in the past. But the politicisation around them is new.

title: Gareth Southgate assesses England's World Cup group
description: England manager Gareth Southgate says he is intrigued by the fixtures in Group B of the Fifa World Cup which sees his side face the USA, Iran and one of Wales, Scotland or Ukraine.

title: Who allowed the energy price cap to rise so much? And other questions
description: As a new price cap takes effect, causing energy bills to soar, we answer your questions.

title: Derby driver crashes new Ferrari straight after buying it
description: Police say the car's new owner crashed after driving it for less than two miles.

title: World Cup 2022: How has Qatar treated stadium workers?
description: Qatar has used thousands of foreign workers to build its World Cup facilities. Many may have died.

title: Chris Rock did not want Will Smith ejected from Oscars, producer says
description: Will Packer has described what happened after Will Smith slapped Chris Rock at the awards ceremony.

title: Conversion therapy: Ban to go ahead but not cover trans people
description: The government changes its mind within hours but transgender people will not be covered by the plans.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia accuses Ukraine of attacking oil depot
description: Russia claims a Ukrainian helicopter raid set fuel tanks ablaze in Belgorod, a Russian city.

title: Cricket World Cup: England-Australia final to be shown free to air on Sunday
description: England's Women's World Cup final against Australia on Sunday will be made available on free to air by Sky Sports with commentary on BBC Radio 5 live.

title: Women's Six Nations: England's Natasha Hunt returns against Italy
description: Scrum-half Natasha Hunt will make her first England appearance since November 2020 in Sunday's Women's Six Nations game in Italy.

title: Just Stop Oil protests: Terminal operations suspended and arrests made
description: Thirteen people are arrested as climate change campaign groups target critical fuel sites across England.

title: Covid: Record 4.9 million people have the virus in UK
description: The latest data from the ONS suggests some 4.9 million people in the UK are infected with the virus.

title: Bruce Willis: Razzies cancel 'worst performance' award over health issues
description: Razzie organisers said it was "not appropriate" after the announcement about actor's health issues.

title: Premier League returns: What are main issues to look out for this weekend?
description: The final international break of 2021-22 is over, leaving us to focus on the business end of a gripping domestic season, starting this weekend.

title: National Lottery: Camelot launches legal challenge over licence loss
description: It says the decision to award the National Lottery licence to another operator is "badly wrong".

title: Gerard Depardieu: Kremlin responds to actor's Putin criticism
description: The French-born actor had accused the Russian president of "crazy, unacceptable excesses" in Ukraine.

title: Starmer wants Carrie Johnson named if fined for parties
description: The Labour leader says people in Downing Street who broke the rules should not keep it secret.

title: Money saving tips: How to cut spending as energy bills rise
description: Four experts share practical ways to protect your finances and soften the blow of rising bills.

title: Bruno Fernandes: Manchester United midfielder extends deal to 2026
description: Manchester United midfielder Bruno Fernandes signs a new deal that runs to 2026 with the club.

title: Energy price: Bill shock for millions as rises hit
description: A host of essential bills - dominated by energy - are rising from now with warnings of more to come.

title: Chevron Championship: Georgia Hall contends as Jennifer Kupcho and Minjee Lee co-lead
description: England's Georgia Hall is in contention after round one of the Chevron Championship - the first women's major of the year.

title: Ukraine war: Gruesome evidence points to war crimes on road outside Kyiv
description: The BBC finds the charred remains of civilians on a highway where Russian troops had stationed tanks.

title: Easter airport queue warning amid staff shortages
description: The Airport Operators Association warned staff shortages and absences could put operations under strain.

title: Referee Mike Dean on '22 years at top'
description: Premier League referee Mike Dean tells BBC Sport’s Mark Chapman of his love for football and reflects on "22 years at the top" as he prepares to retire at the end of the season.

title: Queen's life at Balmoral celebrated in exhibition
description: The Platinum Jubilee event includes an imposing sculpture highlighting salmon conservation on the River Dee.

title: Chip shortage: Has Europe's plan arrived too late?
description: The European Union is investing billions of euros in developing a world-beating chip industry.

title: China: Peeking into the private lives of livestreamers
description: A photo series profiles people who have shot to fame in one of China's fastest growing industries.

title: UK farmers call for weedkiller ban over Parkinson’s fears
description: Some farmers say studies suggest Paraquat could be a factor in the onset of Parkinson's Disease.
